$interpreted: Sherlock: Your dance today attracted a lot of customers again. Good job~
Lisa: ...Thank you for the compliment...
Sherlock: By the way, why did you put the flowers here?
Lisa: I want to see my most treasured item at all times when I dance...
Sherlock: Most treasured item? What is that?
Lisa: ...*cough*...something really precious, something you don't want to give to others. Do you not have an item like that?
Sherlock: No. To me, anything can be sold at the right price...
Sherlock: Ah, money is probably the closest thing I have. Very important, money is. Haha...
Lisa: ...*cough*...what's wrong?
Sherlock: The joints in my shoulder are a bit rusty...but I can't reach it with my hands, so I can't apply oil to them...
Lisa: Let me help you...
Lisa: Is it here?...*cough*...*cough*...
Sherlock: Yes~ right there. Ahhh~ This feels nice~
Chatty Auntie: Look, that's him. The mechanician who adopted a child for more than a month now.
Nosy Auntie: I heard that mechanicians have no emotion. Does he really know how to take care of a child?
Sherlock: Are you two here to buy something? If not, then get lost!
Chatty Auntie: Hmph, noisy tin can.
Lisa: ...*cough*...*cough*......*cough*...
Sherlock: Lisa!? Lisa, what's the matter?
Chatty Auntie: Holy, this little girl has a serious fever!
Nosy Auntie: I've been hearing her coughing for a while now. Is she sick?
Sherlock: Cough? She has been making that noise for the past three or four days.
Chatty Auntie: My god! You heard her coughing for days and did nothing at all?
Sherlock: What should I do then? Does she need to change parts?
Nosy Auntie: She's not a mechanician; she doesn't have "parts" to change, you tin can! Take her to a doctor outside of the Bazaar!
Sherlock: Understood. Lisa, I'll take you there!
Chatty Auntie: As expected, a mechanician has no idea how to take care of a child...
Nosy Auntie: Poor kid. I wonder if she will die...
Sherlock: I won't allow you to collapse on me! I still need you to dance and gather customers for me!
Sherlock: Outta my way!
Sherlock: How is it? Will Lisa be alright?

Doctor: The little girl is safe now. Where are her parents?
Why did it take them such a long time to discover her illness?
Sherlock: Both her parents died in the war. I'm taking care of her right now.
Doctor: A mechanician taking care of a human child?
Doctor: You mechanicians and us humans are fundamentally different species. If something like this happens again,
Doctor: her life may be in serious danger.

Sherlock: Then what should I do? 
Hire a human to take care of her?
Doctor: For the sake of this little girl, I have a suggestion...
